parameter.name: title
parameter.shortdesc: The name of the Submenu for display in the user interface. The title includes any ampersand characters &#40;&&#41;, which are used to tell the Windows OS to underline the following character in the name for use with the Alt key to navigate to a menu item. Double ampersands are used to display an actual ampersand character in the name. The Mac OS ignores and removes the extra ampersand characters.

parameter.name: at
parameter.shortdesc: The location of the submenu relative to the reference object or within the containing object. &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: reference
parameter.shortdesc: The reference object. Note: Required when the at parameter specifies before or after. &#40;Optional)

parameter.name: withProperties
parameter.shortdesc: Initial values for properties of the new Submenu &#40;Optional)

method.name: count
method.shortdesc: Displays the number of elements in the Submenu.

method.name: item
method.shortdesc: Returns the Submenu with the specified index or name.

parameter.name: index
parameter.shortdesc: The index or name. Can accept: Long Integer or String.

method.name: itemByName
method.shortdesc: Returns the Submenu with the specified name.

method.name: itemByRange
method.shortdesc: Returns the Submenus within the specified range.

parameter.name: from
parameter.shortdesc: The Submenu, index, or name at the beginning of the range. Can accept: Submenu, Long Integer or String.

parameter.name: to
parameter.shortdesc: The Submenu, index, or name at the end of the range. Can accept: Submenu, Long Integer or String.

method.name: firstItem
method.shortdesc: Returns the first Submenu in the collection.

method.name: lastItem
method.shortdesc: Returns the last Submenu in the collection.

method.name: middleItem
method.shortdesc: Returns the middle Submenu in the collection.

method.name: previousItem
method.shortdesc: Returns the Submenu with the index previous to the specified index.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.shortdesc: The index of the Submenu that follows the desired Submenu.

method.name: nextItem
method.shortdesc: Returns the Submenu whose index follows the specified Submenu in the collection.

parameter.name: obj
parameter.shortdesc: The Submenu whose index comes before the desired Submenu.

method.name: anyItem
method.shortdesc: Returns any Submenu in the collection.

method.name: everyItem
method.shortdesc: Returns every Submenu in the collection.

method.name: toSource
method.shortdesc: Generates a string which, if executed, will return the Submenu.
Returns the Submenu with the specified index.

property.name: length
property.shortdesc: The number of objects in the collection.
